title: Unexpected type for async closure?
body:
```
alexgaynor@penguin /t/x> rustc --version
rustc 1.38.0-nightly (273f42b59 2019-07-21)
```

```rust
#![feature(async_await, async_closure)]

use futures::stream::StreamExt;

pub async fn f<Fut: std::future::Future<Output = ()> + std::marker::Unpin>(data: &mut [Fut]) {
    data.iter_mut()
        .map(async move |d| {
            d.await;
        })
        .collect::<futures::stream::FuturesOrdered<_>>()
        .buffered(16)
        .for_each(async move |()| ())
        .await;
}
```

This produces:

```
alexgaynor@penguin /t/x> cargo build
   Compiling x v0.1.0 (/tmp/x)
error[E0277]: the trait bound `(): core::future::future::Future` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:11:10
   |
11 |         .buffered(16)
   |          ^^^^^^^^ the trait `core::future::future::Future` is not implemented for `()`

error[E0599]: no method named `for_each` found for type `futures_util::stream::buffered::Buffered<futures_util::stream::futures_ordered::FuturesOrdered<impl core::future::future::Future>>` in the current scope
  --> src/lib.rs:12:10
   |
12 |         .for_each(async move |()| ())
   |          ^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: the method `for_each` exists but the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
           `&futures_util::stream::buffered::Buffered<futures_util::stream::futures_ordered::FuturesOrdered<impl core::future::future::Future>> : futures_util::stream::StreamExt`
           `&mut futures_util::stream::buffered::Buffered<futures_util::stream::futures_ordered::FuturesOrdered<impl core::future::future::Future>> : futures_util::stream::StreamExt`
           `&mut futures_util::stream::buffered::Buffered<futures_util::stream::futures_ordered::FuturesOrdered<impl core::future::future::Future>> : std::iter::Iterator`
           `futures_util::stream::buffered::Buffered<futures_util::stream::futures_ordered::FuturesOrdered<impl core::future::future::Future>> : futures_util::stream::StreamExt`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```

I would have expected `async move || {}` to give me a `Future<Output = ()>`, instead from the error message it seems to be returning `()`. This is unexpected. I'm not sure if this is an error with return types or a bug with async closures returning the unit type.
